channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-9925] ClientTest.testSimpleRequests fails on Travis
item.description: ClientTest.testSimpleRequests fails on Travis with an AssertionError: https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/405690023/log.txt

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I run the test locally ~ 100 times, but can produce this error. If I can reproduce this error, maybe I could help to fix it.

Another instance on release-1.7@ef683c3ea56b5e82971035790955d895d93ccd5a: https://travis-ci.org/apache/flink/jobs/456572019

Tests run: 6, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 24.186 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.flink.queryablestate.network.ClientTest
testSimpleRequests(org.apache.flink.queryablestate.network.ClientTest)  Time elapsed: 20.004 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: Receive timed out
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertNotNull(Assert.java:712)
	at org.apache.flink.queryablestate.network.ClientTest.testSimpleRequests(ClientTest.java:170)

I ran locally the test and the whole ClientTest suite both on master and release-1.7 in a loop, which is the reported version where the bug was observed and I cannot reproduce it.

I would suggest to close it until someone reports it again. WDYT till.rohrmann?

I am the Flink Jira Bot and I help the community manage its development. I see this issues has been marked as Critical but is unassigned and neither itself nor its Sub-Tasks have been updated for 14 days. I have gone ahead and marked it "stale-critical". If this ticket is critical, please either assign yourself or give an update. Afterwards, please remove the label or in 7 days the issue will be deprioritized.

This issue was labeled "stale-critical" 7 days ago and has not received any updates so it is being deprioritized. If this ticket is actually Critical, please raise the priority and ask a committer to assign you the issue or revive the public discussion.

I think the problem is that the channel handlers are not shareable:

================================================================================
Test testSimpleRequests(org.apache.flink.queryablestate.network.ClientTest) is running.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I cannot explain why multiple pipelines are being created but if this happens, then the pipeline will fail because the handler cannot be reused. I propose to change this since the problematic handler is stateless.
Have we actually observed a failure since FLINK-23362 was merged?
Given that FLINK-23362 has been merged 6 days ago, we did not observe another instance of this failure since then.
